meanings.definition: A person who is not directly involved in an activity or situation.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the sideliners cheered for their team.
meanings.sent2: The sideliners watched the soccer match from the stands.
meanings.sent3: The sideliners joked about starting their own game on the sidelines.
meanings.sent4: Even though they were sideliners, their support was crucial for the team.
meanings.sent5: The sideliners enjoyed the game atmosphere without being in the middle of the action.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are not actively participating in an event.
meanings.sent1: The sideliners chatted and laughed while waiting for their turn.
meanings.sent2: At the concert, the sideliners relaxed and enjoyed the music.
meanings.sent3: The sideliners decided to have their own mini-party on the sidelines.
meanings.sent4: The sideliners formed a supportive community outside the main event.
meanings.sent5: The sideliners observed the event from a different perspective.

meanings.definition: A player who is not in the starting lineup but is available as a substitute.
meanings.sent1: The coach called one of the sideliners to warm up on the field.
meanings.sent2: The sideliners practiced diligently, ready to step in if needed.
meanings.sent3: The sideliners playfully teased each other about being on standby.
meanings.sent4: Being a sideliners doesn't mean you're not important to the team.
meanings.sent5: The sideliners were prepared to enter the game at a moment's notice.
